intro: Sphacele urbani, commonly known as the urban sphacele, is a flowering plant native to certain urban environments. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can thrive in areas with limited sunlight. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. Sphacele urbani is often overlooked due to its small size but plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
